demolition job.translation[0].definition: an act of criticizing someone severely or telling other people things about them which may be unfair or untrue, in order to harm them or to cause people to have a bad opinion of them
He accused opposition leaders of doing a demolition job on the president.
an event, especially a sports event, in which one person or team defeats the other one very easily
Currie led the team with 55 points in the demolition job against Ireland.
